rockets package¶

Module contents¶

class rockets.Component(body, vertices, density, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC, pymunk.shapes.Poly

Extention of pymunk Poly class with properties for sprites/textures and shape (vertices)

classmethod getDisplayInfo()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary that contains relevant “pretty” Information to display in the rocket builder

Returns:Dictionary of formatted component properties
Return type:Dict
classmethod getInfo()[source]¶

Dictionary of specific component properties.

Returns:Dictionary of unformatted component properties
Return type:Dict
reset()[source]¶

Resets the destroyed status of the component.

_abc_impl = <_abc_data object>¶
sprite¶

This should return a surface that represents the component’s sprite/texture

vertices¶

This should return the vertices of the component

class rockets.SAS(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.component.Component

SAS component for rocket. Provides encapsulation for SAS autonomous angle and magnitude of SAS force. Must be attached to a body.

classmethod getDisplayInfo()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary that contains relevant “pretty” Information to display in the rocket builder

Returns:Dictionary of formatted component properties
Return type:Dict
classmethod getInfo()[source]¶

This method is what will define the properties of a specific SAS subclass. It should return a dictionary with the following values:

Dictionary Key Dictionary Value Type
vertices (List of pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d)
SASPower (float)
tolerance (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d)
sprite (pygame.surface.Surface) It is advised this be stored as a class variable, and returned by this method to improve performance.
maxFuel (float) Should always be 0
density (float)
holdAngle(timescale)[source]¶

Will work to hold the rocket at the set SASAngle. This is affected by the SASPower and the Tolerance parameters of a specific SAS Module.

reset()[source]¶

Resets the SAS Module, including the set angle and fuel ammount.

rotateClockwise(timescale)[source]¶

Uses the RCS Thrusters on the host rocket to turn the rocket clockwise.

rotateCounterClockwise(timescale)[source]¶

Uses the RCS Thrusters on the host rocket to turn the rocket counter-clockwise.

SASPower¶

The SASPower of this specific type of SASModule. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

SASangle¶

Lock angle in radians for the SAS

_abc_impl = <_abc_data object>¶
fuel¶

The current ammount of fuel that the SAS module has for maneuvering.

maxFuel¶

The maximum fuel ammount of this specific type of SASModule. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

sprite¶

The sprite of this specific type of SASModule. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

tolerance¶

The angle tolerance of this specific type of SASModule. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

vertices¶

The vertices of this specific type of SASModule. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

class rockets.AdvancedSAS(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.sas.SAS

The AdvancedSAS components will all share these properties:

Dictionary Key Dictionary Value Type
vertices [(-12,4), (-12,-6), (12,-6), (12,4)]
SASPower 2.0
tolerance .01
sprite AdvancedSAS.png
maxFuel 20,000
density 73.8
classmethod getInfo()[source]¶

This method is what will define the properties of a specific SAS subclass. It should return a dictionary with the following values:

Dictionary Key Dictionary Value Type
vertices (List of pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d)
SASPower (float)
tolerance (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d)
sprite (pygame.surface.Surface) It is advised this be stored as a class variable, and returned by this method to improve performance.
maxFuel (float) Should always be 0
density (float)
_abc_impl = <_abc_data object>¶
_sprite = <Surface(24x10x32 SW)>¶

Holds the SAS sprite to prevent repeated loading. Sprite is AdvancedSAS.png

class rockets.Tank(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.component.Component

Tank Component for rocket. Holds fuel for all liquid thrusters to pull from as a source Must be attached to a body.

reset()[source]¶

Resets the Tank, resets fuel amount to the capacity

_abc_impl = <_abc_data object>¶
capacity¶

The maximum amount of fuel a tank can hold The tank will be initialized with this amount of fuel

fuel¶

The current ammount of fuel remaining in the Tank

sprite¶

The sprite of this specific type of Tank. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

vertices¶

The vertices of this specific type of Tank. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

class rockets.TestTank(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.tank.Tank

The TestTank components will all share these properties:

Dictionary Key Dictionary Value Type
vertices [(-6, 18), (-6, -18), (6, -18), (6, 18)]
sprite TestTank.png
capacity 20,000
density 73.8

Returns unformatted

_abc_impl = <_abc_data object>¶
_capacity = 20000¶
_density = 73.8¶
_sprite = <Surface(12x36x24 SW)>¶
_vertices = [(-6, 18), (-6, -18), (6, -18), (6, 18)]¶
class rockets.CommandModule(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.component.Component

The CommandModule doesn’t serve much purpose on its own other than being a shape with collision and a sprite. It is supposed to represent the center/heart of the rocket, being a cockpit for its hypothetical crew.

classmethod getDisplayInfo()[source]¶

Return “pretty” info for disply in the rocket builder

Returns:Dictionary of display properties
Return type:Dict
classmethod getInfo()[source]¶

Dictionary of specific component properties.

Returns:Dictionary of unformatted component properties
Return type:Dict
reset()[source]¶

Reset the command module’s underlying component

_abc_impl = <_abc_data object>¶
_density = 34¶

The density of the command module.

_sprite = <Surface(100x100x32 SW)>¶

The sprite of the command module.

sprite¶

The sprite of the command module.

vertices¶

The vertices of the shape of the Command Module.

class rockets.Thruster(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.component.Component

Thruster Interface for creation of thrusters. Individual named thrusters inherit from and implement this class. Most of the implementation is already done within this interface, with key parts left out for the subclasses to make their own.

applyThrust(throttle, timescale)[source]¶

Applies thrust to the rocket, scaling the thrust to a throttle value between 0 and 1. The thrust provided and fuel consumed are then scaled by the provide timescale.

Parameters:
  • throttle (float) – The ammount to throttle the thrust by, between 0 and 1
  • timescale (float) – The ammount to scale the thrust provided and fuel consumed.
classmethod getDisplayInfo()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary containing the “Thrust” and “Thrust Vector” of the rocket with units attatched for display to the screen or user.

classmethod getInfo()[source]¶

This method is what will define the properties of a specific Thruster subclass.

reset()[source]¶

Resets properties of the underlying component and the fuel of the thruster to restart the simulation

thrust()[source]¶

Returns the scaled thrust vector of the Thruster.

_abc_impl = <_abc_data object>¶
sprite¶

The sprite to use to render the thruster. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

thrustForce¶

The magnitude of the thrust of this specific type of thruster. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

thrustVector¶

The direction that the thruster will apply thrust. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

vertices¶

The vertices of this specific type of thruster. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

class rockets.DeltaVee(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.thruster.SolidThruster

DeltaVee is the biggest, baddest Thruster and will all share these properties:

Dictionary Key Dictionary Value Type
vertices [(12, 0), (-12, 0), (12, 70), (-12, 70)]
thrustForce 500000.0
thrustVector (1, 0)
sprite DeltaVee.png
maxFuel 40,000
density 73.8
classmethod getInfo()[source]¶

Returns the dictionary with info specified by Thruster.getInfo()

_abc_impl = <_abc_data object>¶
_sprite = <Surface(10x100x32 SW)>¶

Holds the thruster sprite to prevent repeated loading. Sprite is DeltaVee.png

thrustForce (float)
thrustVector (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d)

density (float)

_sprite = <Surface(10x10x24 SW)>¶
class rockets.RCSThruster(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.thruster.Thruster

An RCS Thruster is intended to be a smaller thruster, that pulls fuel from the rocket’s SAS fuel instead of its own supply and is used for rotation instead of direct motion.

applyThrust(timescale)[source]¶

The RCSThruster applies thrust differently from normal Thrusters. The RCSThruster will check if there is an SAS module on the host Rocket that it can draw fuel from before it fires.

classmethod getInfo()[source]¶

This method is what will define the properties of a specific RCSThruster subclass. It is identical to the Thruster getInfo, but the maxFuel member is always 0.

Dictionary Key Dictionary Value Type
vertices (List of pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d)
thrustForce (float)
thrustVector (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d)
sprite (pygame.surface.Surface) It is advised this be stored as a class variable, and returned by this method to improve performance.
maxFuel (float) Should always be 0
density (float)
reset()[source]¶

Resets properties of the underlying component and the fuel of the thruster to restart the simulation

_abc_impl = <_abc_data object>¶
class rockets.RightRCS(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.thruster.RCSThruster

RightRCS Thrusters will all share these properties:

Dictionary Key Dictionary Value Type
vertices [(0, 37), (-5, 37), (-5, 42), (0, 42)]
thrustForce 5000.0
thrustVector (1, 0)
sprite RCSRight.png
maxFuel 0.0
density 45.0
classmethod getInfo()[source]¶

Returns the dictionary with info specified by Thruster.getInfo()

_abc_impl = <_abc_data object>¶
_sprite = <Surface(5x5x32 SW)>¶

Holds the thruster sprite to prevent repeated loading. Sprite is RCSRight.png

density (float)

Holds the thruster sprite to prevent repeated loading. Sprite is RCSLeft.png

class rockets.Rocket(components=[])[source]¶

Bases: pymunk.body.Body

Extends pymunk.Body, and can hold and represent physics for the components of the rocket.

addComponent(c)[source]¶

Add a new component to the rocket

Parameters:c (Component) – The component to add to the rocket
debugComponentPrint()[source]¶

Prints out the verticies of all the components in this rocket.

handleEvent(event)[source]¶

A pygame event handler, currently only checks for the SAS angle-toggle key V

removeComponent(c)[source]¶

Removes a component from the rocket

Parameters:c (Component) – The component to remove from the rocket
reset()[source]¶

Resets information about this rocket for purposes of restarting the simulation. This includes the destroyed flag, the position, velocity, angle, throttle, isAngleLocked, and also resets every component of the rocket.

tick(timescale)[source]¶

Allows the rocket to perform its functions, checking input and applying thrust and rotation to itself.

RCSThrusters¶

A list of all of the RCSThruster components that have been attatched to the rocket.

SASmodules¶

A list of all of the SAS components that have been attatched to the rocket.

commandModules¶

A list of all of the CommandModule components that have been attatched to the rocket.

components¶

A list of all of the individual Component objects that have been attatched to the rocket. The list is presented in the order of Thruster, SAS, CommandModule, RCSThruster

isAngleLocked¶

Boolean, whether or not the rocket is attempting to hold itself to a certain angle.

tanks¶

A list of all of the Tank components that have been attatched to the rocket.

throttle¶

The Throttle represents how much of the thrusters’ power is being used, from 0 - 1.

thrusters¶

A list of all of the Thruster components - but not RCSThruster components - that have been attatched to the rocket.

Submodules¶

A pygame event handler, currently only checks for the SAS angle-toggle key V

Removes a component from the rocket

Parameters:c (Component) – The component to remove from the rocket
reset()[source]¶

Resets information about this rocket for purposes of restarting the simulation. This includes the destroyed flag, the position, velocity, angle, throttle, isAngleLocked, and also resets every component of the rocket.

tick(timescale)[source]¶

Allows the rocket to perform its functions, checking input and applying thrust and rotation to itself.

A list of all of the RCSThruster components that have been attatched to the rocket.

A list of all of the CommandModule components that have been attatched to the rocket.

A list of all of the individual Component objects that have been attatched to the rocket. The list is presented in the order of Thruster, SAS, CommandModule, RCSThruster

Boolean, whether or not the rocket is attempting to hold itself to a certain angle.

A list of all of the Tank components that have been attatched to the rocket.

The Throttle represents how much of the thrusters’ power is being used, from 0 - 1.

A list of all of the Thruster components - but not RCSThruster components - that have been attatched to the rocket.

applyThrust(throttle, timescale)[source]¶

Applies thrust to the rocket, scaling the thrust to a throttle value between 0 and 1. The thrust provided and fuel consumed are then scaled by the provide timescale.

Parameters:

  • timescale (float) – The ammount to scale the thrust provided and fuel consumed.

thrustForce (float)
thrustVector (pymunk.vec2d.Vec2d)
sprite (pygame.surface.Surface) It is advised this be stored as a class variable, and returned by this method to improve performance.
maxFuel (float) Should always be 0
density (float)
reset()[source]¶

Resets properties of the underlying component and the fuel of the thruster to restart the simulation

fuel¶

The current ammout of fuel that the thruster has. Cannot be set below zero.

maxFuel¶

The maximum ammount of fuel that the thruster starts with. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

class rockets.thruster.Thruster(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.component.Component

Thruster Interface for creation of thrusters. Individual named thrusters inherit from and implement this class. Most of the implementation is already done within this interface, with key parts left out for the subclasses to make their own.

applyThrust(throttle, timescale)[source]¶

Applies thrust to the rocket, scaling the thrust to a throttle value between 0 and 1. The thrust provided and fuel consumed are then scaled by the provide timescale.

Parameters:
  • throttle (float) – The ammount to throttle the thrust by, between 0 and 1
  • timescale (float) – The ammount to scale the thrust provided and fuel consumed.
classmethod getDisplayInfo()[source]¶

Returns a dictionary containing the “Thrust” and “Thrust Vector” of the rocket with units attatched for display to the screen or user.

classmethod getInfo()[source]¶

This method is what will define the properties of a specific Thruster subclass.

reset()[source]¶

Resets properties of the underlying component and the fuel of the thruster to restart the simulation

thrust()[source]¶

Returns the scaled thrust vector of the Thruster.

sprite¶

The sprite to use to render the thruster. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

thrustForce¶

The magnitude of the thrust of this specific type of thruster. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

thrustVector¶

The direction that the thruster will apply thrust. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

vertices¶

The vertices of this specific type of thruster. This returns the value defined in the getInfo method.

class rockets.thruster.UpGoer2000(body, transform=None, radius=0)[source]¶

Bases: rockets.thruster.SolidThruster

UpGoer2000 Thrusters will all share these properties:

Dictionary Key Dictionary Value Type
vertices [(4.2, 0), (-4.2, 0), (4.2, 46.9), (-4.2, 46.9)]
thrustForce 50,000.0
thrustVector (1, 0)
sprite UpGoer2000.png
maxFuel 10,000
density 73.8
classmethod getInfo()[source]¶

Returns the dictionary with info specified by Thruster.getInfo()

_sprite = <Surface(10x100x32 SW)>¶

Holds the thruster sprite to prevent repeated loading. Sprite is UpGoer2000.png
